bigshot

Class ImageInsert

  • java.lang.Object
    • bigshot.ImageInsert

  • public class ImageInsert
extends Object
    An image that is projected into an existing panorama. The position of the image can be given in two ways - either as a {yaw, pitch, roll, vfov} quadruplet of angles, or as three vectors - {topLeft, u, v}. If the topLeft vector is set, the image insert will use the latter method to insert the image.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Creates a new image insert.

      • parseVectors

        public static ImageInsert parseVectors(String decl)
        Parses a command-line parameter describing the image insert. The parameter is a comma-separated list consisting of ten elements: topLeft.x,topLeft.y,topLeft.z,u.x,u.y,u.z,v.x,v.y,v.z,imageFile.
        Returns:
        a new ImageInsert instance with the topLeft, u, and v and imageFile parameters set

      • parseAngles

        public static ImageInsert parseAngles(String decl)
        Parses a command-line parameter describing the image insert. The parameter is a comma-separated list consisting of five elements: yaw,pitch,roll,vfov,imageFile.
        Returns:
        a new ImageInsert instance with the yaw, pitch, roll, vfov, and imageFile parameters set

      • apply

        public void apply(AbstractCubicTransform xform)
           throws Exception
        Inserts the image into the panorama. If the insert position has been given as a {topLeft, u, v}, the transform is unchanged. Otherwise, the transform's view and vfov are set and previous settings lost.
        Throws:
        Exception
